div.p: had pillaged them of all the furrs they had & besides had taken 3 of their women from them[.] This is the old Custom of the red Knives they wish to revive former times[.] [I]f they should unfortunately meet with my Indians above the old Fort & behave in the same manner, Adieu all hopes of returns for next year[.] War, war, is spoken of already as if it had actually began[.] Grand Chefre says that a war party of the rapid Indians from Mr Grants Fort has Killed a great many of the dahodinnais of Blue Fish river[.] What demon has possessed the Inhabitants of this Quarter this year, every thing seems to alter for the worse[.] Report also says that the 3 Canadians who Mr Clarke sent off last Fall in quest of the women who deserted from Bear lake last year, have not returned[.] Grand Chefre says he thinks they have been killed – perhaps he is sure of it[.] This if true might have been foreseen by Mr Clarke himself[.]

Suny 20th[.] Sent off the Grand Chefre & band desired him to come in the Fall as soon as the leaves begin to fall from the Trees in order to Know what is to be done with regard to Embayodinnais[.] [H]e also promised to send provisions thro the Course of the Summer he wished greatly to have had a frenchman with him[.] I told him it was impossible for me to let him have one[.] Fine weather[.]
Mony 21st[.] The men Scraped the Canoe & Plastered the In & Outside of the House[.] Fine weather[.]

Tuesy 22nd 23rd, 24th, 25th, 26th, 27th[.] Since the 22nd the men have been employed about the Houses, Garden & Fishing, The last however has been lost time for we can take no Fish – no more than 11 Ps has been caught in all this time[.]
